subject: Sexual Health
title: Attachment and Oxytocin
description: A 60-second lesson on Attachment and Oxytocin.

hook.text: After the dopamine rush of new love fades, oxytocin takes over to build lasting attachment and trust.

buildup.text: Oxytocin is released during cuddling, sex, and prolonged eye contact, deepening emotional bonds.

discovery.text: Vasopressin, a related hormone, also promotes pair bonding, especially in men after sexual intimacy.

twist.text: Prairie voles that are monogamous have more oxytocin receptors than their promiscuous meadow vole cousins.

climax.text: Long-term love is not diminished passion. It is a different, deeper brain state built on attachment chemistry.

punchline.text: Dopamine starts love. Oxytocin makes it last.

quiz.question: What hormone takes over to sustain long-term attachment?
